vision: The easiest journal to use (voice-first) with the most powerful analytics (structured, queryable life database)

target_audience.primary: ADHD adults who struggle with manual journaling/tracking and want voice-first capture with gamification to stay motivated
secondary: Quantified self enthusiasts tracking mood, health, and productivity metrics
Busy professionals who want frictionless life logging
Fitness and health trackers wanting unified workout/nutrition/mood logging
Knowledge workers seeking timeline-based personal analytics

phases.name: Foundation & Revenue
phases.description: Critical stabilization, monetization, and D1 retention fixes to ensure business viability and user trust

milestones.title: Revenue Generation Ready
milestones.description: Users can subscribe to premium features and app is legally compliant for App Store

milestones.title: Data Safety Guaranteed
milestones.description: User data syncs bidirectionally - no risk of data loss from lost devices

milestones.title: First-Run Experience Complete
milestones.description: New users can onboard successfully and understand the app's value within 2 minutes

phases.name: Core Experience Enhancement
phases.description: Complete the MVP feature set and address critical competitor pain points to deliver differentiated value

milestones.title: 100% Offline Reliable
milestones.description: Voice capture works offline with guaranteed sync when connectivity returns

milestones.title: Habit System Complete
milestones.description: Full habit creation and management on mobile matches desktop functionality

milestones.title: AI Insights Active
milestones.description: Users receive meaningful AI-generated reflections and pattern insights

milestones.title: External Integration
milestones.description: Google Calendar sync enables schedule-aware capture and planning

phases.name: Growth & Differentiation
phases.description: Build competitive moats through advanced features, performance, and developer infrastructure

milestones.title: Development Excellence
milestones.description: CI/CD pipeline with test coverage enables confident, rapid releases

milestones.title: Performance Optimized
milestones.description: Focus mode and calendar views perform smoothly without excessive re-renders

milestones.title: Quantified Self Champion
milestones.description: Life Tracker rivals Nomie with advanced visualizations and correlations

phases.name: Future Vision
phases.description: Long-term features for market expansion and platform maturity

milestones.title: Platform Ecosystem
milestones.description: Apple Watch capture and widget support extend voice-first capture to new surfaces

milestones.title: Data Liberation
milestones.description: Full data export ensures users own their life data forever

features.title: Subscription System & Payment Processing
features.description: Implement in-app purchases and subscription management for premium features. Include free tier with limits, monthly and annual plans, and payment processing via App Store and Play Store.
features.rationale: Critical business viability - solo developer needs revenue within 2 weeks to sustain development. Monetization is the highest priority constraint.
acceptance_criteria: Users can view subscription plans with pricing
Users can purchase monthly or annual subscription
Premium features are gated for free users with clear upgrade prompts
Subscription status syncs across devices
Users can manage/cancel subscription through native app store flow
user_stories: As a committed user, I want to subscribe to premium so that I can unlock advanced features and support development
As a free user, I want to understand what premium offers so that I can decide if it's worth upgrading

features.title: Privacy Policy & Terms of Service
features.description: Create legally compliant privacy policy and terms of service documents. Include data collection practices, third-party services (OpenAI, Supabase), user rights, and compliance with GDPR/CCPA.
features.rationale: Required for App Store submission and builds user trust. Day One users cite trust issues (pain-2-1) - transparency is competitive advantage.
acceptance_criteria: Privacy policy accessible in app and on landing page
Terms of service accessible in app and on landing page
Documents cover data collection, storage, and third-party processing
Documents are App Store compliant
Users must accept ToS during onboarding
user_stories: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to understand how my data is handled so that I can trust the app with my personal journal
As a user in the EU, I want GDPR-compliant data handling so that my rights are protected

features.title: Bidirectional Sync with Conflict Resolution
features.description: Implement full bidirectional sync between local storage and Supabase with intelligent conflict resolution. Ensure no data loss when editing on multiple devices.
features.rationale: Critical for data safety - users lose trust when data disappears. Day One (pain-2-1), Tiimo (pain-3-5), and Habitica (pain-1-2) all lost users due to sync/data issues.
acceptance_criteria: Changes on mobile sync to desktop within 30 seconds
Changes on desktop sync to mobile within 30 seconds
Conflicting edits are resolved with last-write-wins or user choice
Sync errors are surfaced clearly with retry options
Full sync status is visible to users
user_stories: As a multi-device user, I want my entries to sync automatically so that I never lose my journal data
As a user who lost a device, I want my data safe in the cloud so that I can recover on a new device

features.title: Sync Preferences & Multipliers to Supabase
features.description: Extend bidirectional sync to include user preferences and goal multipliers. Currently these are local-only and lost on device change.
features.rationale: Part of complete data sync story - users expect all settings to follow them across devices. Addresses technical debt identified in discovery.
acceptance_criteria: User preferences sync between devices
Goal importance multipliers sync between devices
Theme and notification settings sync
Settings changes propagate within 30 seconds
user_stories: As a multi-device user, I want my preferences synced so that my experience is consistent everywhere
As a user setting up a new device, I want my multipliers preserved so I don't have to reconfigure goals

features.title: First-Run Onboarding Flow
features.description: Create guided onboarding that teaches voice capture, demonstrates AI parsing, and shows gamification value within 2 minutes. Include sample capture, dashboard tour, and initial habit setup.
features.rationale: Current 80%+ D1 churn risk due to no onboarding. Users need to understand voice-first value immediately. Notion (pain-4-2) and Obsidian (pain-5-1) lose ADHD users to complexity - Insight must show simplicity instantly.
acceptance_criteria: New users see onboarding flow on first launch
Onboarding demonstrates voice capture with example
Onboarding shows AI parsing result
Onboarding explains XP and gamification
Users can skip onboarding if desired
Onboarding completes in under 2 minutes
user_stories: As a new user, I want to quickly understand how voice capture works so that I can start journaling immediately
As an ADHD user, I want a simple intro so that I don't feel overwhelmed before I even start

features.title: Analytics & Error Tracking
features.description: Implement analytics (usage patterns, feature adoption) and error tracking (crashes, API failures) to understand user behavior and fix issues proactively.
features.rationale: Currently flying blind - cannot improve what you cannot measure. Critical for understanding D7 retention and identifying friction points.
acceptance_criteria: Crash reports captured and logged
API failures tracked with context
Key user actions tracked (voice capture, habit logging, etc.)
Funnel analysis possible (onboarding, feature adoption)
Privacy-respecting implementation (no personal content)
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see crash reports so that I can fix bugs before users report them
As a developer, I want usage analytics so that I can prioritize features users actually use

features.title: Welcome Email Sequence
features.description: Send automated email sequence to new users: welcome email with tips, day 3 check-in, day 7 feature highlight. Encourage engagement and reduce early churn.
features.rationale: Supports onboarding with persistent reminders outside the app. Helps D7 retention goal of 40%.
acceptance_criteria: Welcome email sent on account creation
Day 3 email with voice capture tips
Day 7 email highlighting underused features
Users can unsubscribe from emails
Email templates match app branding
user_stories: As a new user, I want helpful tips via email so that I remember to use the app and learn its features
As a busy user, I want reminders outside the app so that I build a journaling habit

features.title: Offline Capture Queue
features.description: Enable voice capture when offline with guaranteed sync when connectivity returns. Store recordings locally with metadata, transcribe and parse when online.
features.rationale: 100% offline reliability is a success metric. AudioNotes (pain-8-1) lost users due to unreliable offline. Local-first architecture makes this achievable.
acceptance_criteria: Voice capture works without network connection
Offline recordings stored locally with timestamp and duration
Queue status visible to users
Automatic transcription and parsing when online
Failed items can be retried manually
No recordings lost due to connectivity issues
user_stories: As a commuter, I want to capture voice notes in the subway so that I don't lose thoughts when offline
As a traveler, I want offline journaling so that I can track my trip without data roaming

features.title: Complete Mobile Habit Creation Form
features.description: Finish the incomplete habit creation form on mobile to match desktop functionality. Include all habit types, scheduling options, and goal settings.
features.rationale: Mobile is the primary capture device - incomplete features frustrate users. Feature parity critical when Day One (pain-2-2) users complain about Android gaps.
acceptance_criteria: All habit types available on mobile (daily, weekly, timed)
Scheduling options work (time of day, days of week)
Goal and target settings functional
Form validation matches desktop
Habit creation success rate matches desktop
user_stories: As a mobile-first user, I want to create habits on my phone so that I don't need my computer for setup
As an ADHD user, I want to create a habit when motivated so that I capture the impulse immediately

features.title: Voice-Created Habits
features.description: Allow users to create new habits through voice commands. AI parses intent and creates properly configured habit with sensible defaults.
features.rationale: Extends voice-first philosophy to habit creation. Tiimo users (pain-3-1) cite complex input as why they quit - voice eliminates this entirely.
acceptance_criteria: User can say 'Create a habit to drink water every morning'
AI parses habit name, schedule, and type
Reasonable defaults applied for missing info
User can confirm or edit AI-suggested habit
Works for common habit patterns (daily, weekly, timed)
user_stories: As an ADHD user, I want to speak new habits into existence so that I capture motivation instantly
As a voice-first user, I want habit creation to match capture simplicity so that setup isn't a barrier

features.title: AI Reflections & Weekly Synthesis
features.description: Generate AI-powered weekly reflections summarizing activities, mood patterns, and achievements. Replace stub implementation with functional synthesis.
features.rationale: Differentiator vs Apple Journal (pain-6-5) and AudioNotes (pain-8-4) which lack insights. ADHD users need external processing help.
acceptance_criteria: Weekly summary generated from captured data
Highlights achievements and XP earned
Notes mood/energy patterns if tracked
Suggests focus areas for next week
Accessible from dashboard and timeline
user_stories: As an ADHD user, I want the app to summarize my week so that I can see progress without manual review
As a quantified self user, I want pattern insights so that I understand what affects my mood and energy

features.title: Mood-Activity Correlation Dashboard
features.description: Show correlations between captured activities and tracked mood/energy levels. Help users discover what activities improve or hurt their wellbeing.
features.rationale: Addresses pain point #5 (difficulty correlating mood/energy with activities). Fills market gap-6 - no app does this with voice-captured data.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows mood/energy trends over time
Activities associated with high/low mood highlighted
Weekly/monthly view options
Clear visualizations (not just numbers)
Actionable insights surfaced
user_stories: As someone managing my mental health, I want to see what affects my mood so that I can do more of what helps
As a quantified self user, I want correlations discovered automatically so that I don't have to analyze manually

features.title: Google Calendar Bidirectional Sync
features.description: Implement the currently-stubbed Google Calendar integration. Pull events for context-aware parsing and optionally push captured events back to calendar.
features.rationale: Currently returns 501 Not Implemented. Calendar context makes AI parsing smarter. Busy professionals (secondary persona) need calendar integration.
acceptance_criteria: Users can connect Google Calendar
Calendar events visible in Tiimo-style view
Voice capture uses calendar context for parsing
Optional: captured events can sync to calendar
OAuth flow handles token refresh
user_stories: As a professional, I want my calendar events in Insight so that I have a unified view of my day
As a time-blind user, I want calendar integration so that scheduled events appear in my timeline

features.title: Apple Health Integration
features.description: Import workout, sleep, and activity data from Apple Health. Correlate with mood and manual entries for complete quantified self picture.
features.rationale: Health trackers are secondary persona. Apple's walled garden approach (pain-6-2) locks data - we should pull it free for analysis.
acceptance_criteria: Users can connect Apple Health on iOS
Workout data imported automatically
Sleep data imported if available
Data appears in timeline and correlations
Permission flow is clear and privacy-respecting
user_stories: As a fitness tracker, I want my workout data in Insight so that I can see fitness impact on mood
As a sleep-aware user, I want sleep data imported so that I can correlate rest with productivity

features.title: Comprehensive Test Suite
features.description: Increase test coverage from 5% to 60%+ with unit tests for core logic, integration tests for sync, and E2E tests for critical flows.
features.rationale: Tiimo (pain-3-3) and Habitica (pain-1-2) suffer from bug cycles. Tests enable confident releases without regression roulette.
acceptance_criteria: Core logic (XP calculation, streak tracking) has 90%+ coverage
Sync layer has integration tests
Critical user flows have E2E tests
Overall coverage reaches 60%
Tests run in CI pipeline
user_stories: As a developer, I want comprehensive tests so that I can ship features without fear of breaking existing functionality
As a user, I want a stable app so that bugs don't interrupt my journaling habit

features.title: CI/CD Pipeline with Automated Releases
features.description: Build complete CI/CD pipeline: automated tests on PR, staging deployment, production release automation for mobile and desktop.
features.rationale: Currently missing - manual releases slow iteration and risk errors. Enables rapid response to bug reports.
acceptance_criteria: Tests run automatically on pull requests
Staging environment receives automatic deploys
Production releases automated with approval gate
Mobile builds (iOS/Android) automated
Desktop builds (Mac/Windows) automated
user_stories: As a developer, I want automated releases so that I can ship updates quickly and safely
As a developer, I want PR checks so that broken code doesn't reach main branch

features.title: Feature Flags for Safe Rollouts
features.description: Implement feature flag system for gradual rollouts and A/B testing. Enable safe deployment of risky features with kill switch capability.
features.rationale: Enables safe iteration without risking all users. Critical for solo developer managing risk across platforms.
acceptance_criteria: Feature flags can be toggled remotely
Flags support percentage rollouts
Kill switch can disable feature instantly
Flag state syncs across app restart
Clear developer documentation for flag usage
user_stories: As a developer, I want feature flags so that I can test new features with a subset of users
As a developer, I want a kill switch so that I can disable broken features without a new release

features.title: Focus View Performance Optimization
features.description: Optimize Focus view that currently updates every 400ms causing excessive re-renders. Implement efficient timer updates.
features.rationale: Performance impacts user experience, especially on older devices. ADHD users need smooth experience to stay focused.
acceptance_criteria: Timer updates efficiently (requestAnimationFrame or similar)
CPU usage reduced by 50%+ during focus sessions
No visible jank or stuttering
Battery impact minimized on mobile
user_stories: As a user in a focus session, I want smooth timer updates so that the app doesn't distract me
As a mobile user, I want efficient updates so that my battery lasts through long sessions

features.title: Calendar View Memoization
features.description: Optimize calendar view that currently recalculates on every render. Implement proper memoization for efficient updates.
features.rationale: Calendar view is frequently used - performance directly impacts daily experience. Technical debt flagged in discovery.
acceptance_criteria: Calendar only recalculates when data changes
Navigation between days/weeks is instant
Drag-drop operations remain smooth
Memory usage stable during extended use
user_stories: As a daily user, I want fast calendar navigation so that checking my schedule is effortless
As an ADHD user, I want instant visual feedback so that I don't lose focus waiting for updates

features.title: Advanced Life Tracker Correlations
features.description: Enhance Life Tracker with automatic correlation detection between tracked variables. Show when tracked behaviors affect each other.
features.rationale: Fills Nomie gap (pain-7-1) with enhanced analytics. Quantified self users want to discover patterns without manual analysis.
acceptance_criteria: Automatic correlation detection between trackers
Significant correlations highlighted in dashboard
Time-lagged correlations detected (e.g., coffee â†’ sleep)
Statistical confidence shown for correlations
Correlations explainable in plain language
user_stories: As a quantified self user, I want automatic correlation detection so that I discover patterns I'd miss manually
As a health-conscious user, I want to understand behavior impacts so that I can optimize my lifestyle

features.title: Life Tracker CSV Import from Nomie
features.description: Enable import of Nomie export files to capture former Nomie users seeking a replacement. Smooth migration path.
features.rationale: Nomie discontinuation (pain-7-1, pain-7-2) left users stranded. Direct import removes migration barrier.
acceptance_criteria: Nomie CSV export format recognized
Trackers mapped to Life Tracker equivalents
Historical data imported with timestamps
Data validation and error handling
Import preview before confirmation
user_stories: As a former Nomie user, I want to import my data so that I don't lose years of tracking history
As a quantified self enthusiast, I want migration tools so that switching apps isn't painful

features.title: Apple Watch Voice Capture
features.description: Enable voice capture directly from Apple Watch for ultimate frictionless logging. Sync recordings to phone for processing.
features.rationale: Extends voice-first to the wrist - fastest possible capture. Tiimo has Watch support (competitor strength) - match and exceed it.
acceptance_criteria: Voice capture complication on Watch face
Recordings sync to phone for processing
Quick habit logging from Watch
XP and streak status visible on Watch
Reliable operation even with phone not nearby
user_stories: As an Apple Watch user, I want to capture thoughts from my wrist so that I never miss a fleeting idea
As a runner, I want to log my workout via Watch so that I don't have to pull out my phone

features.title: iOS Home Screen Widget
features.description: Create iOS widgets for quick habit logging, capture button, and streak/XP status. Enable glanceable engagement.
features.rationale: Reduces friction further - don't even need to open app. Addresses 'out of sight out of mind' issue (pain-4-3) for ADHD users.
acceptance_criteria: Small widget shows streak and XP
Medium widget shows today's habits with quick toggle
Large widget shows timeline preview
Tap on widget opens relevant screen
Widgets update reliably in background
user_stories: As an ADHD user, I want habits visible on my home screen so that I remember to do them
As a streak-motivated user, I want to see my streak without opening the app so that I stay motivated

features.title: Full Data Export (YAML/Markdown)
features.description: Enable complete data export in human-readable formats (YAML, Markdown). Ensure users own their data forever, even if they leave.
features.rationale: Addresses Apple Journal (pain-6-2) and Day One (pain-2-1) data lock-in concerns. Differentiator for privacy-conscious users.
acceptance_criteria: Export all entries in Markdown format
Export structured data in YAML
Export includes all metadata (dates, tags, trackers)
Export is complete and lossless
Files are organized by date/type
user_stories: As a data ownership advocate, I want to export everything so that I'm never locked in
As an Obsidian user, I want Markdown export so that I can use my journal data elsewhere

features.title: Import from Day One / Obsidian
features.description: Enable import from popular journaling apps to ease migration. Support Day One JSON export and Obsidian markdown vault.
features.rationale: Day One users frustrated with post-acquisition quality decline (pain-2-4) need migration path. Lower switching costs.
acceptance_criteria: Day One JSON export format supported
Obsidian markdown files importable
Entries parsed with dates and tags preserved
Import preview with mapping options
Media attachments handled where possible
user_stories: As a Day One refugee, I want to import my journal so that I don't lose years of entries
As an Obsidian user, I want to try Insight without losing my existing notes
